This research is intended to inform the specification of Category 2A threshold conditions.

change.subject: Paragraph 4
change.quote: (4) In the case of regulations under paragraph 1(3), within the period of six months beginning with the day on which this Act is passed, OFCOM must carry out research into— (a) the dissemination of illegal content and content that is harmful to children by means of regulated user-to-user services, (b) the number of users and functionalities of the user-to-user part of such services, and (c) such other characteristics of that part of such services or factors relating to that part of such services as OFCOM consider to be relevant to specifying the Category 2B threshold conditions.
change.summary: The proposed change is to require OFCOM to carry out research into the dissemination of illegal content and content harmful to children by regulated user-to-user services, the number of users and functionalities of such services, and other relevant characteristics or factors. This research is intended to inform the specification of Category 2B threshold conditions.

change.subject: Paragraph 5
change.quote: (5) OFCOM must provide the Secretary of State with advice based on the research under sub-paragraph (2), (3) or (4) (as the case may be) as to the provision which OFCOM consider it is appropriate for the regulations in question to make.
change.summary: The proposed change is to require OFCOM to provide the Secretary of State with advice based on the research conducted regarding the regulation of user-generated content and search engines. This advice will inform the appropriate provisions to be included in the regulations.

change.subject: Paragraph 6
change.quote: (6) Such advice may include advice that the regulations should include another characteristic or factor in addition to number of users and (in the case of regulations under paragraph 1(1) or (3)) functionalities, and what that other characteristic or factor should be.
change.summary: The proposed change allows the advice provided by OFCOM to include recommendations for additional characteristics or factors to be considered in the regulations, beyond the number of users and functionalities.

change.subject: Paragraph 7
change.quote: (7) As soon as reasonably practicable after OFCOM provide advice as mentioned in sub-paragraph (5)— (a) OFCOM must publish the advice, and (b) the Secretary of State must make the regulations.
change.summary: The proposed change requires OFCOM to publish their advice and for the Secretary of State to make the regulations based on that advice as soon as reasonably practicable.

change.subject: Paragraph 8
change.quote: (8) If the regulations include provision which differs in any material respect from provision advised by OFCOM, the Secretary of State must publish a statement which explains why the Secretary of State has departed from that advice.
change.summary: The proposed change requires the Secretary of State to publish a statement explaining any departures from the advice provided by OFCOM if the regulations include provisions that differ from that advice in any material respect.

change.subject: Paragraph 9
change.quote: (9) A statement mentioned in sub-paragraph (8) must be published— (a) no later than the time at which the regulations to which the statement relates are made, and (b) in such manner as the Secretary of State considers appropriate for bringing it to the attention of persons who may be affected by it.
change.summary: The proposed change requires the statement explaining departures from OFCOM's advice to be published no later than the time the regulations are made and in a manner that brings it to the attention of affected persons.

change.subject: Paragraph 10
change.quote: (10) The Secretary of State may give OFCOM extra time to carry out their research in the case of regulations under paragraph 1(2) or (3), but OFCOM must carry out such research within the period of 18 months beginning with the day on which this Act is passed.
change.summary: The proposed change allows the Secretary of State to grant OFCOM additional time to carry out research for regulations under paragraph 1(2) or (3), but requires the research to be completed within 18 months from the passing of the Act.

change.subject: Paragraph 11
change.quote: (11) The Secretary of State may not make regulations under paragraph 1 until OFCOM have carried out research and provided advice to the Secretary of State as required by this paragraph.
change.summary: The proposed change prohibits the Secretary of State from making regulations under paragraph 1 until OFCOM have completed the required research and provided advice to the Secretary of State.

change.subject: Paragraph 3
change.quote: (3) Regulations in force under paragraph 1(2) may not be amended or replaced by further regulations under that provision except following further research carried out by OFCOM into the matters mentioned in paragraph 2(3).
change.summary: The proposed change states that regulations under paragraph 1(2) cannot be amended or replaced without further research conducted by OFCOM into the matters mentioned in paragraph 2(3).

change.subject: Paragraph 4
change.quote: (4) Regulations in force under paragraph 1(3) may not be amended or replaced by further regulations under that provision except following further research carried out by OFCOM into the matters mentioned in paragraph 2(4).
change.summary: The proposed change states that regulations under paragraph 1(3) cannot be amended or replaced without further research conducted by OFCOM into the matters mentioned in paragraph 2(4).

change.subject: Paragraph 5
change.quote: (5) A request from the Secretary of State to OFCOM to carry out further research must indicate why the Secretary of State considers that to be necessary.
change.summary: The proposed change requires the Secretary of State to provide a reason for requesting further research from OFCOM.

change.subject: Paragraph 6
change.quote: (6) Where such research is carried out, OFCOM must provide the Secretary of State with advice as to whether, in OFCOM’s opinion— (a) it is appropriate to make changes to the regulations in question, specifying the changes that OFCOM recommend, or (b) it is not appropriate to make any changes to the regulations in question.
change.summary: The proposed change requires OFCOM to provide the Secretary of State with advice on whether changes to the regulations are appropriate based on the research conducted. OFCOM must specify the recommended changes or state that no changes are necessary.

change.subject: Paragraph 7
change.quote: (7) OFCOM must publish such advice as soon as reasonably practicable after providing it to the Secretary of State.
change.summary: The proposed change requires OFCOM to publish their advice as soon as reasonably practicable after providing it to the Secretary of State.

change.subject: Paragraph 8
change.summary: The proposed change requires the Secretary of State to publish a statement explaining any departures from OFCOM's advice if the new regulations include provisions that differ in any material respect. Additionally, if OFCOM's advice was not to make any changes, the Secretary of State must publish a statement explaining the reasons for the new regulations.

change.subject: Paragraph 9
change.quote: (9) Where OFCOM’s advice is as mentioned in sub-paragraph (6)(a) and the Secretary of State does not make new regulations, the Secretary of State must, as soon as reasonably practicable, publish a statement explaining that decision.
change.summary: The proposed change requires the Secretary of State to publish a statement explaining the decision not to make new regulations if OFCOM's advice was to make changes but the Secretary of State decides not to proceed with them.

change.subject: Paragraph 10
change.quote: (10) A statement mentioned in sub-paragraph (8) must be published no later than the time at which the regulations to which the statement relates are made.
change.summary: The proposed change requires the statement explaining departures from OFCOM's advice to be published no later than the time the regulations to which the statement relates are made.

change.subject: Paragraph 11
change.quote: (11) A statement mentioned in sub-paragraph (8) or (9) must be published in such manner as the Secretary of State considers appropriate for bringing it to the attention of persons who may be affected by it.
change.summary: The proposed change requires the statement explaining departures from OFCOM's advice or the decision not to make new regulations to be published in a manner that brings it to the attention of persons who may be affected by it.

change.subject: Paragraph 5
change.quote: (5) OFCOM may give the provider of a regulated service a notice (an “audit notice”) requiring the provider to permit OFCOM to carry out an audit— (a) to assess whether the provider has complied or is complying with enforceable requirements that apply in respect of the service, or (b) to assess— (i) the nature and level of risk of the provider failing to comply with an enforceable requirement that applies in respect of the service, and (ii) ways to mitigate such a risk.
change.summary: The proposed change allows OFCOM to give a notice to a regulated service provider, called an "audit notice," requiring the provider to permit OFCOM to carry out an audit. The purpose of the audit is to assess the provider's compliance with enforceable requirements and to assess the nature and level of risk of non-compliance and ways to mitigate that risk.

change.subject: Paragraph 6
change.summary: The proposed change outlines the actions that an audit notice may require a regulated service provider to take, including permitting entry and inspection of premises, observation of the service, directing to relevant documents, assisting in viewing information, complying with requests for copies of documents or information, providing explanations, and making individuals available for interviews.

change.subject: Paragraph 8
change.summary: The proposed change allows OFCOM to revoke or vary an audit notice by providing a further notice. This gives OFCOM the flexibility to modify or remove the requirements of the original notice if necessary.

change.subject: Paragraph 3(a)
change.quote: (3) Those powers are not exercisable in respect of domestic premises.
change.summary: The proposed change adds a new provision stating that the powers conferred by paragraph 2 (entry and inspection without warrant) and powers exercisable under a warrant are not applicable to domestic premises.

change.subject: Paragraph 3(b)
change.quote: (3) Those powers are not exercisable in relation to information or documents in respect of which a claim to legal professional privilege, or (in Scotland) to confidentiality of communications, could be maintained in legal proceedings.
change.summary: The proposed change adds a new provision stating that the powers conferred by paragraph 2 (entry and inspection without warrant) and powers exercisable under a warrant are not applicable to information or documents that are subject to legal professional privilege or confidentiality of communications in legal proceedings.

change.subject: Paragraph 18(1)
change.summary: The proposed change introduces new offences related to obstructing or failing to comply with the requirements imposed by a person acting under this Schedule.

change.subject: Paragraph 19
change.quote: In this Schedule— “domestic premises” means premises, or a part of premises, used as a dwelling; “premises” means premises in the United Kingdom.
change.summary: The proposed change adds definitions for "domestic premises" and "premises" in the context of this Schedule.

change.subject: Paragraph 21
change.quote: In this Schedule “enforceable requirement” has the same meaning as in Chapter 6 of Part 7 (see section 132), except that— (a) it does not include— (i) a requirement under (or a requirement of a notice under) section 105 (reports by skilled persons), or (ii) a requirement imposed by a person acting under this Schedule; (b) it includes a requirement imposed by a notice under section 122(1) (notices to deal with terrorism content and CSEA content).
change.summary: The proposed change provides a definition for "enforceable requirement" in the context of this Schedule, specifying that it does not include certain requirements under section 105 and includes requirements imposed by a notice under section 122(1).

change.subject: Paragraph 22
change.quote: In paragraphs 6 to 17 and 20 “warrant” means a warrant issued under paragraph 5.
change.summary: The proposed change provides a definition for "warrant" in the context of this Schedule, specifying that it means a warrant issued under paragraph 5.

change.subject: Paragraph 24
change.quote: “Online Safety Act 2023, sections 180 and 182”.
change.summary: The proposed change adds the Online Safety Act 2023, sections 180 and 182 to the list of relevant enactments for the purposes of relevant functions under the Regulatory Enforcement and Sanctions Act 2008.

change.subject: section 65A of the Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984
change.quote: "In section 65A of the Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984 (“qualifying offences” for the purposes of Part 5 of that Act), in subsection (2)(p) after “61 to” insert “66A, 66B(2) and (3),”."
change.summary: The amendment adds offenses under sections 66A, 66B(2), and 66B(3) of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 as "qualifying offenses" for the purposes of Part 5 of the Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984.

change.subject: section 6 of the Sexual Offences (Amendment) Act 1992
change.quote: "In section 6 of the Sexual Offences (Amendment) Act 1992 (interpretation), after subsection (2A) insert— “(2B) For the purposes of this Act, where it is alleged or there is an accusation that an offence under section 66B(4) of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 (threatening to share intimate photograph or film) has been committed, the person against whom the offence is alleged to have been committed is to be regarded as— (a) the person to whom the threat mentioned in that subsection is alleged to have been made, and (b) (if different) the person shown, or who appears to be shown, in an intimate state in the photograph or film that is the subject of the threat.”"
change.summary: The amendment clarifies the interpretation of the Sexual Offences (Amendment) Act 1992 in cases where an offense under section 66B(4) of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 (threatening to share intimate photograph or film) is alleged.

change.subject: various sections of the Sexual Offences Act 2003
change.quote: "In section 78 (meaning of “sexual”), after “15A” insert “, 66B to 66D”."
"In section 136A(3A) (specified child sex offences), in paragraph (c), after “66” insert “, 66A, 66B(2) and (3)”."

"In Schedule 3 (sexual offences for purposes of Part 2), after paragraph 33 insert— “33A An offence under section 66A of this Act (sending etc photograph or film of genitals) if— (a) where the offender was under 18, the offender is or has been sentenced in respect of the offence to imprisonment for a term of at least 12 months; (b) in any other case— (i) the victim was under 18, or (ii) the offender, in respect of the offence or finding, is or has been— (a) sentenced to a term of imprisonment, (b) detained in a hospital, or (c) made the subject of a community sentence of at least 12 months. 33B An offence under section 66B(3) of this Act (sharing intimate photograph or film for purpose of obtaining sexual gratification) if— (a) where the offender was under 18, the offender is or has been sentenced in respect of the offence to imprisonment for a term of at least 12 months; (b) in any other case— (i) the victim was under 18, or (ii) the offender, in respect of the offence or finding, is or has been— (a) sentenced to a term of imprisonment, (b) detained in a hospital, or (c) made the subject of a community sentence of at least 12 months.”."
change.summary: The amendments add offenses under sections 66A and 66B of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 to various sections of the Act, specifying the conditions under which these offenses are considered and the corresponding penalties.

change.subject: various sections of the Criminal Justice Act 2003
change.quote: "In Part 2 of Schedule 15 (specified sexual offences for purposes of section 325), after paragraph 149 insert— “149A An offence under section 66A of that Act (sending etc photograph or film of genitals). 149B An offence under section 66B(2) or (3) of that Act (sharing intimate photograph or film with intent to cause alarm, distress or humiliation or for purpose of obtaining sexual gratification).”"

"In Schedule 34A (child sex offences for purposes of section 327A), in paragraph 10— (a) after “66” insert “, 66A, 66B(2) or (3)”, and (b) after “exposure” insert “, sending etc photograph or film of genitals, sharing intimate photograph or film with intent to cause alarm, distress or humiliation or for purpose of obtaining sexual gratification”."
change.summary: The amendments add offenses under sections 66A and 66B of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 to various sections of the Criminal Justice Act 2003, specifying the conditions under which these offenses are considered and the corresponding penalties.

change.subject: section 116 of the Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act 2014
change.quote: "In section 116 of the Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act 2014 (information about guests at hotels believed to be used for child sexual exploitation), in subsection (8)(c), in the entry that relates to exposure and voyeurism offences in the Sexual Offences Act 2003— (a) after “66” insert “, 66A, 66B(2) and (3)”, and (b) after “exposure” insert “, sending etc photograph or film of genitals, sharing intimate photograph or film with intent to cause alarm, distress or humiliation or for purpose of obtaining sexual gratification”."
change.summary: The amendment expands the offenses listed in section 116 of the Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act 2014 to include offenses under sections 66A and 66B of the Sexual Offences Act 2003.

change.subject: Schedule 4 to the Modern Slavery Act 2015
change.quote: "In Schedule 4 to the Modern Slavery Act 2015 (offences to which defence in section 45 does not apply), in paragraph 33 (offences under Sexual Offences Act 2003), after the entry for section 66 insert— “section 66A (sending etc photograph or film of genitals) section 66B(2) (sharing intimate photograph or film with intent to cause alarm, distress or humiliation) section 66B(3) (sharing intimate photograph or film for purpose of obtaining sexual gratification)”."
change.summary: The amendment adds offenses under sections 66A and 66B of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 to the list of offenses to which the defense in section 45 of the Modern Slavery Act 2015 does not apply.

change.subject: Part 2 of Schedule 18 to the Sentencing Act 2020
change.quote: "In Part 2 of Schedule 18 to the Sentencing Act 2020 (specified sexual offences for purposes of section 306), in paragraph 38 (offences under Sexual Offences Act 2003), after sub-paragraph (ax) insert— “(axa) section 66A (sending etc photograph or film of genitals); (axb) section 66B(2) (sharing intimate photograph or film with intent to cause alarm, distress or humiliation); (axc) section 66B(3) (sharing intimate photograph or film for purpose of obtaining sexual gratification);”."
change.summary: The amendment adds offenses under sections 66A and 66B of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 to the list of specified sexual offenses for the purposes of section 306 of the Sentencing Act 2020.

change.subject: Schedule 9 to the Elections Act 2022
change.quote: "In Schedule 9 to the Elections Act 2022 (offences for purposes of Part 5), after paragraph 47(f) insert— “(g) section 66A (sending etc photograph or film of genitals).”"
change.summary: The amendment adds offenses under section 66A of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 to the list of offenses for the purposes of Part 5 of the Elections Act 2022.

change.subject: section 96 of the Criminal Justice and Courts Act 2015
change.quote: "In section 96 (extent), in subsection (6), omit paragraphs (c) and (g)."
change.summary: The amendment removes paragraphs (c) and (g) from subsection (6) of section 96 of the Criminal Justice and Courts Act 2015.

change.subject: sections 69, 85, and 86 of the Domestic Abuse Act 2021
change.quote: "Omit section 69 (threats to disclose private sexual photographs and films with intent to cause distress) and the italic heading before it."
"In section 85 (power to make consequential provision), in subsection (1)(b), omit “69,”."
"In section 86 (power to make transitional or saving provision), in subsection (1)(b), omit “69,”."
change.summary: The amendments remove section 69 of the Domestic Abuse Act 2021, along with its heading, and make consequential changes to sections 85 and 86 of the Act.

change.subject: Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Overseas Operations (Service Personnel and Veterans) Act 2021
change.quote: "In Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Overseas Operations (Service Personnel and Veterans) Act 2021 (“excluded offences” for the purposes of section 6 of that Act), omit paragraph 11."
change.summary: The amendment removes paragraph 11 from Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Overseas Operations (Service Personnel and Veterans) Act 2021.

change.subject: regulation 8 of the Criminal Justice (Electronic Commerce) (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2021 (S.I. 2021/835)
change.quote: "In the Criminal Justice (Electronic Commerce) (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2021, omit regulation 8 (amendment of the Criminal Justice and Courts Act 2015)."
change.summary: The amendment deletes regulation 8 of the Criminal Justice (Electronic Commerce) (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2021, which pertains to the amendment of the Criminal Justice and Courts Act 2015.

change.subject: Schedule 15 of the Online Safety Bill
change.quote: "SCHEDULE 15 Section 198 LIABILITY OF PARENT ENTITIES ETC Joint provisional notices of contravention 1 (1) This paragraph applies if— (a) OFCOM are satisfied that there are grounds to give an entity (“E”) a provisional notice of contravention relating to a regulated service, and (b) E is the provider of that service. (2) If there is an entity which is a parent undertaking in relation to E, the provisional notice of contravention may be given— (a) to E alone, or (b) jointly to E and to an entity which is a parent undertaking in relation to E. (3) If there is an entity which is a subsidiary undertaking in relation to E, the provisional notice of contravention may be given— (a) to E alone, or (b) jointly to E and to an entity which is a subsidiary undertaking in relation to E. (4) If E is a subsidiary undertaking and there is an entity which is a fellow subsidiary undertaking in relation to E, the provisional notice of contravention may be given— (a) to E alone, or (b) jointly to E and to an entity which is a fellow subsidiary undertaking in relation to E. (5) If an individual or individuals control E (see paragraph 5(4)), the provisional notice of contravention may be given— (a) to E alone, or (b) jointly to E and to the individual or individuals who control E. (6) If a provisional notice of contravention is given jointly as mentioned in subparagraph (2)(b), (3)(b), (4)(b) or (5)(b), section 131(8) is to be read, in its application for the purposes of this paragraph, as if it included a reference to representations about whether joint and several liability would be appropriate."
change.summary: The amendment introduces provisions regarding joint provisional notices of contravention and joint and several liability of parent entities, subsidiary entities, fellow subsidiary entities, and controlling individuals in relation to regulated services.

change.subject: Schedule 16 of the Online Safety Bill
change.quote: "SCHEDULE 16 Section 210 AMENDMENTS OF PART 4B OF THE COMMUNICATIONS ACT 1 Part 4B of the Communications Act (video-sharing platform services) is amended in accordance with this Schedule. 2 In section 368U (maintenance of list of providers)— (a) omit subsection (2); (b) for subsection (3) substitute— “(3) OFCOM must publish the up to date list on a publicly accessible part of their website.”"
change.summary: The amendment makes changes to Part 4B of the Communications Act, specifically in relation to the maintenance of the list of providers of video-sharing platform services.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 212
change.quote: “pre-existing Part 4B service” means— (a) an internet service which— (i) is a video-sharing platform service by reason of the conditions in section 368S(1) and (2) of the Communications Act being met in relation to the service as a whole, and (ii) was being provided immediately before this Schedule comes into force; or (b) a dissociable section of an internet service, where that dissociable section— (i) is a video-sharing platform service by reason of the conditions in section 368S(1)(a) and (2) of the Communications Act being met in relation to that dissociable section, and (ii) was being provided immediately before this Schedule comes into force.
change.summary: The definition of "pre-existing Part 4B service" is introduced, which refers to an internet service that meets the conditions of being a video-sharing platform service and was being provided before the schedule comes into force.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 212
change.quote: “the relevant day”, in relation to a pre-existing Part 4B service or to a service which includes a pre-existing Part 4B service, means— (a) the date when section 211 comes into force (repeal of Part 4B of the Communications Act), or (b) if the pre-existing Part 4B service ceases to be a video-sharing platform service before the date mentioned in paragraph (a), the date when that service ceases to be a video-sharing platform service;
change.summary: The term "the relevant day" is defined, which refers to the date when section 211 comes into force or the date when a pre-existing Part 4B service ceases to be a video-sharing platform service.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 212
change.quote: “safety duties” means the duties mentioned in section 7(2), (4) and (5), except the duties set out in— (a) section 9 (illegal content risk assessments), (b) section 11 (children’s risk assessments), (c) section 14 (assessments related to the adult user empowerment duty set out in section 15(2)), and (d) section 23(2), (9) and (10) (records of assessments);
change.summary: The term "safety duties" is defined, which refers to the duties mentioned in section 7(2), (4), and (5), excluding specific duties related to illegal content risk assessments, children's risk assessments, assessments related to adult user empowerment, and records of assessments.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 212
change.quote: “the transitional period”, in relation to a pre-existing Part 4B service or to a service which includes a pre-existing Part 4B service, means the period— (a) beginning with the date when this Schedule comes into force, and (b) ending with the relevant day;
change.summary: The term "the transitional period" is defined, which refers to the period starting from when the schedule comes into force and ending with the relevant day.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 212
change.quote: “video-sharing platform service” has the same meaning as in Part 4B of the Communications Act (see section 368S of that Act).
change.summary: The term "video-sharing platform service" is defined, which has the same meaning as in Part 4B of the Communications Act.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 281
change.quote: This paragraph applies in relation to a pre-existing Part 4B service which— (a) is within the definition in paragraph (a) of paragraph 1(1), and (b) is also a regulated user-to-user service.
change.summary: Paragraph 3 applies to a pre-existing Part 4B service that falls within the definition in paragraph (a) of paragraph 1(1) and is also a regulated user-to-user service.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 281
change.quote: Both this Act and Part 4B of the Communications Act apply in relation to the pre-existing Part 4B service during the transitional period.
change.summary: Both the Online Safety Bill and Part 4B of the Communications Act apply to the pre-existing Part 4B service during the transitional period.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 281
change.summary: During the transitional period, certain duties and requirements under the Online Safety Bill do not apply to the pre-existing Part 4B service, including safety duties, duties related to fraudulent advertising, user identity verification, reporting CSEA content, terms of service, deceased child users, transparency reports, and requirements to produce transparency reports.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 281
change.quote: OFCOM’s powers under Schedule 12 to this Act (powers of entry, inspection and audit) do not apply during the transitional period in relation to the preexisting Part 4B service.
change.summary: OFCOM's powers of entry, inspection, and audit under Schedule 12 of the Online Safety Bill do not apply to the pre-existing Part 4B service during the transitional period.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 281
change.quote: The duties, requirements and powers mentioned in paragraph 3(4) and (5) do not apply in relation to the regulated service during the transitional period.
change.summary: The duties, requirements, and powers mentioned in paragraph 3(4) and (5) do not apply to the regulated service during the transitional period.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 282
change.quote: The duties set out in section 82 of this Act do not apply during the transitional period in relation to any regulated provider pornographic content published or displayed on a pre-existing Part 4B service.
change.summary: The duties set out in section 82 of the Online Safety Bill do not apply during the transitional period to any regulated provider pornographic content published or displayed on a pre-existing Part 4B service.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 282
change.quote: In the case of a regulated user-to-user service which includes a pre-existing Part 4B service within the definition in paragraph (b) of paragraph 1(1), nothing in sub-paragraph (1) is to be taken to prevent the duties set out in section 82 from applying during the transitional period in relation to any regulated provider pornographic content published or displayed on any other part of the service.
change.summary: In the case of a regulated user-to-user service that includes a pre-existing Part 4B service, the duties set out in section 82 of the Online Safety Bill apply during the transitional period to any regulated provider pornographic content published or displayed on any other part of the service.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: During the transitional period, Part 4B of the Communications Act applies in relation to a pre-existing Part 4B service within the definition in paragraph (b) of paragraph 1(1).
change.summary: During the transitional period, Part 4B of the Communications Act applies to a pre-existing Part 4B service that falls within the definition in paragraph (b) of paragraph 1(1).

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: During the transitional period, this Act applies in relation to the regulated user-to-user service with the modifications set out in paragraph 6, 7, or 8 (whichever applies).
change.summary: During the transitional period, the Online Safety Bill applies to the regulated user-to-user service with the modifications set out in paragraph 6, 7, or 8, depending on the circumstances.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: During the transitional period, the reference to this Act does not include a reference to Part 6 (fees); for the application of Part 6, see Part 3 of this Schedule.
change.summary: During the transitional period, the reference to the Online Safety Bill does not include a reference to Part 6 (fees), which is addressed in Part 3 of this Schedule.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: This paragraph applies in relation to a regulated user-to-user service described in paragraph 5(2) if the service would still be a regulated user-touser service even if the Part 4B part were to be assumed not to be part of the service.
change.summary: This paragraph applies to a regulated user-to-user service described in paragraph 5(2) if the service would still be a regulated user-to-user service even if the Part 4B part were not considered part of the service.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: During the transitional period— (a) any duty or requirement mentioned in paragraph 3(4) which applies in relation to the regulated service is to be treated as applying only in relation to the rest of the service; (b) the powers mentioned in paragraph 3(5) are to be treated as applying only in relation to the rest of the service.
change.summary: During the transitional period, any duty or requirement mentioned in paragraph 3(4) that applies to the regulated service is treated as applying only to the rest of the service, and the powers mentioned in paragraph 3(5) are treated as applying only to the rest of the service.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: This paragraph applies in relation to a regulated user-to-user service described in paragraph 5(2) if the service would be a regulated search service if the Part 4B part were to be assumed not to be part of the service.
change.summary: This paragraph applies to a regulated user-to-user service described in paragraph 5(2) if the service would be a regulated search service even if the Part 4B part were not considered part of the service.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: During the transitional period, no duty or requirement mentioned in paragraph 3(4) applies in relation to the Part 4B part of the service (but that is not to be taken to prevent any other duty or requirement under this Act from applying in relation to the search engine of the service during the transitional period).
change.summary: During the transitional period, no duty or requirement mentioned in paragraph 3(4) applies to the Part 4B part of the service, but this does not prevent any other duty or requirement under the Online Safety Bill from applying to the search engine of the service during the transitional period.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: This paragraph applies in relation to a regulated user-to-user service described in paragraph 5(2) if the service does not fall within paragraph 6 or 7.
change.summary: This paragraph applies to a regulated user-to-user service described in paragraph 5(2) if the service does not fall within paragraph 6 or 7.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: The duties, requirements and powers mentioned in paragraph 3(4) and (5) do not apply in relation to the regulated service during the transitional period.
change.summary: The duties, requirements, and powers mentioned in paragraph 3(4) and (5) do not apply to the regulated service during the transitional period.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: See Part 3 of Schedule 3 for provision about— (a) the timing of certain assessments of pre-existing Part 4B services, and (b) modifications of Parts 1 and 2 of that Schedule in connection with certain assessments of services which include a pre-existing Part 4B service within the definition in paragraph (b) of paragraph 1(1).
change.summary: Part 3 of Schedule 3 provides provisions regarding the timing of certain assessments of pre-existing Part 4B services and modifications of Parts 1 and 2 of that Schedule in connection with certain assessments of services that include a pre-existing Part 4B service within the definition in paragraph (b) of paragraph 1(1).

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: During the transitional period, section 368U of the Communications Act has effect as a requirement to establish and maintain an up to date list of persons providing a video-sharing platform service to which Part 4B applies.
change.summary: During the transitional period, section 368U of the Communications Act is in effect as a requirement to establish and maintain an up-to-date list of persons providing a video-sharing platform service to which Part 4B applies.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: Part 4B of the Communications Act does not apply in relation to a videosharing platform service which is first provided on or after the date when this Schedule comes into force.
change.summary: Part 4B of the Communications Act does not apply to a video-sharing platform service that is first provided on or after the date when this Schedule comes into force.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: Sub-paragraph (2) applies in relation to a pre-existing Part 4B service if— (a) the service ceases to be a video-sharing platform service on a date within the transitional period, and (b) the service begins again to be a video-sharing platform service on some later date within the transitional period. (2) Part 4B of the Communications Act does not start applying again in relation to the service on the date mentioned in sub-paragraph (1)(b).
change.summary: Sub-paragraph (2) applies to a pre-existing Part 4B service if the service ceases to be a video-sharing platform service within the transitional period and begins again to be a video-sharing platform service on a later date within the transitional period. Part 4B of the Communications Act does not start applying again to the service on the date mentioned in sub-paragraph (1)(b).

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: Paragraphs 11 and 12 apply regardless of whether, or when, a provider of a service has notified the appropriate regulatory authority in accordance with section 368V of the Communications Act.
change.summary: Paragraphs 11 and 12 apply regardless of whether or when a provider of a service has notified the appropriate regulatory authority in accordance with section 368V of the Communications Act.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.summary: This Part provides provisions regarding the application of section 84 (duty to notify OFCOM in relation to the charging of fees), section 85 (payment of fees), and Schedule 10 (additional fees) of the Online Safety Bill in relation to a person who is the provider of a relevant regulated service.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: In this Part “relevant regulated service” means— (a) a regulated user-to-user service which is a pre-existing Part 4B service within the definition in paragraph (a) of paragraph 1(1), or (b) a regulated user-to-user service which includes a pre-existing Part 4B service within the definition in paragraph (b) of paragraph 1(1).
change.summary: In this Part, "relevant regulated service" means a regulated user-to-user service that is a pre-existing Part 4B service within the definition in paragraph (a) of paragraph 1(1), or a regulated user-to-user service that includes a pre-existing Part 4B service within the definition in paragraph (b) of paragraph 1(1).

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: Sub-paragraph (2) applies in relation to a person who is the provider of a relevant regulated service, if the person is required by section 84 to give details to OFCOM of the provider’s qualifying worldwide revenue for the qualifying period that relates to a charging year, the provider gives such details in relation to that charging year at a time within the transitional period, and no regulations under section 241(1) have been made before that time specifying that section 211 is to come into force on or before the first day of that charging year.
change.summary: Sub-paragraph (2) applies to a person who is the provider of a relevant regulated service if the person is required to give details to OFCOM of the provider's qualifying worldwide revenue for the qualifying period that relates to a charging year, the provider gives such details within the transitional period, and no regulations have been made specifying that section 211 is to come into force on or before the first day of that charging year.

change.subject: Schedule 17 Section 283
change.quote: During the transitional period, section 85 and Schedule 10 apply in relation to the provider in respect of a non-transitional charging year.
change.summary: During the transitional period, section 85 (payment of fees) and Schedule 10 (additional fees) apply to the provider in respect of a non-transitional charging year.

change.subject: sections 368Z7 and 368Z8
change.quote: The repeal of sections 368Z7 (directions under sections 368Z5 and 368Z6) and 368Z8 (offence relating to such directions) does not affect the application of those sections after the repeal time in connection with a direction given under section 368Z5 as it has effect by virtue of this paragraph.
